sections.title: 1. Product Features & Positioning
sections.content:
Storyboard Master is an AI-powered storyboarding platform for creative professionals.

Core Features:
â€¢ Multiple AI models (Gemini, Zhipu AI, OpenAI, Custom, etc.)
â€¢ Two generation modes: Script-to-Viz + Creative Chat
â€¢ Reference subject support for character consistency
â€¢ Multiple aspect ratio options
â€¢ Color and B&W sketch styles
â€¢ Symbol library camera movement marking system
â€¢ Video API integration (supports Sora 2 and other video generation models)

sections.title: 2. Quick Start
sections.content:
Step 1: Configure API
â‘  Click âš™ï¸ Settings in left toolbar
â‘¡ Select AI provider (Gemini recommended)
â‘¢ Enter API Key
â‘£ Click Test button to verify
â‘¤ Click Save

Step 2: Choose Generation Mode
â€¢ Script-to-Viz: Use when you have a complete script
â€¢ Creative Chat: Use when brainstorming ideas

sections.title: 3. Left Toolbar Guide
sections.content:
Toolbar functions from top to bottom:

âœ‹ Pan Tool
Function: Move canvas view
Operation: Select, then drag canvas

ğŸ¯ Select Tool
Function: Select storyboard frames
Operations:
  Single: Click directly
  Multiple: Shift + Click (one by one)
  Box select: Drag to select multiple
  Select all: Ctrl + A

ğŸ“¥ Upload Tool
Function: Import reference subject or frames
Operation: Click to open menu

âš™ï¸ Settings
Function: Configure API
Operation: Click to open API config

ğŸŒ¸/âš« Color Mode
Function: Toggle color or B&W sketch
Operation: Click to toggle

Zoom Display
Function: Show current zoom level
Operation: Ctrl + Scroll to adjust

ğŸŒ™/â˜€ï¸ Theme
Function: Toggle dark/light mode
Operation: Click to toggle

ä¸­/EN Language
Function: Toggle Chinese/English
Operation: Click to toggle

sections.title: 4. Script-to-Viz Mode
sections.content:
Use when: You have a complete video script

Steps:
â‘  Click "Script-to-Viz" tab on right panel
â‘¡ Enter your script in text box
â‘¢ Set parameters:
   â€¢ Frame count: 1-16 (recommended 4-8)
   â€¢ Style: Choose visual style
   â€¢ Duration: Optional, 5-120 seconds
   â€¢ Aspect ratio: Select output ratio
â‘£ Click "Generate"
â‘¤ Wait for generation

Aspect Ratio Guide:
â€¢ 16:9 (default) - Movies, TV, YouTube
â€¢ 9:16 - Short videos, TikTok, mobile
â€¢ 21:9 - Cinematic ultra-wide
â€¢ 1:1 - Social media, Instagram
â€¢ 4:3 - Presentations, teaching
â€¢ 4:5, 3:2 - Other purposes

âš ï¸ Important:
â€¢ All exported frames must be same ratio
â€¢ Export different ratios separately if needed

sections.title: 5. Creative Chat Mode
sections.content:
Use when: Brainstorming without a complete script

Steps:
â‘  Click "Creative Chat" tab
â‘¡ Enter your creative idea
   Example: "A sci-fi scene in a space station"
â‘¢ Click ğŸš€ Send (or press Enter)
â‘£ AI responds with scene description
â‘¤ Continue conversation to add details
   Example: "Add female astronaut character"
â‘¥ Repeat until satisfied
â‘¦ Set generation parameters
â‘§ Click "Generate Storyboard"

Chat Tips:
â€¢ First message: Overall scene description
â€¢ Follow-up messages: Specific details
â€¢ AI remembers conversation context
â€¢ Last message is most important

Clear Chat:
â€¢ Click ğŸ§¹ Clear button next to input
â€¢ Start new conversation topic

sections.title: 6. Frame Selection & Operations
sections.content:
Selection Methods:

Single Select:
Click directly on frame
Frame shows purple border

Multiple Select (Method 1 - One by one):
Hold Shift key
Click each frame to select
Shift + Click again to deselect

Multiple Select (Method 2 - Box select):
Click and drag on empty area
Drag to select multiple frames
Release to complete
Selection order is recorded for export numbering

Select All:
Press Ctrl + A
All frames selected

Right-Click Menu:
Right-click any frame
Options: Set as main, Replace, Redraw, Batch redraw, Clone, Export, Delete

Drag to Move:
Click and drag frame to new position

Resize:
Drag small triangle at bottom-right corner
Aspect ratio maintained automatically

sections.title: 7. Export Storyboard
sections.content:
Export Steps:
â‘  Select frames to export
â‘¡ Click "Export Storyboard (JPEG)" button
   or right-click and select "Export Storyboard"
â‘¢ System generates JPEG file
â‘£ Auto-downloads to your device

Export File Contains:
â€¢ Reference subject (if any): Red dashed border on left
â€¢ Storyboard frames: Blue solid border, ordered by selection
â€¢ Scene numbers: SC-01, SC-02, SC-03...

Layout:
â€¢ With reference: Max 2 columns
â€¢ Without reference: Auto-adjusts columns

âš ï¸ Important:
â€¢ All exported frames must be same aspect ratio
â€¢ If mixed ratios selected, system shows error
â€¢ Solution: Export different ratios separately

sections.title: 8. Keyboard Shortcuts
sections.content:
Selection:
Ctrl + A: Select all frames
Shift + Click: Select/deselect one by one
Mouse drag: Box select multiple
Delete: Delete selected frames

View:
Ctrl + Scroll: Zoom canvas
  Scroll up: Zoom in
  Scroll down: Zoom out
  On reference: Zoom reference only
Mouse drag: Pan canvas (with pan tool selected)

Menu:
Right-click: Open frame menu

Chat:
Enter: Send message
Shift + Enter: New line

sections.title: 8.1 Reference Subject Independent Zoom
sections.content:
Use when: Need to adjust reference subject size separately

Steps:
â‘  Move mouse to reference subject image
â‘¡ Hold Ctrl key
â‘¢ Scroll mouse wheel up to zoom in
â‘£ Scroll mouse wheel down to zoom out

Effects:
â€¢ Reference subject zooms independently
â€¢ Other frames unaffected
â€¢ Zoom ratio is saved

âš ï¸ Note:
â€¢ Must operate on reference subject for independent zoom
â€¢ Ctrl + Scroll elsewhere zooms entire canvas

sections.title: 8.2 Symbol Library Drag & Drop
sections.content:
Use when: Add camera movements to frames

Steps:
â‘  Find "Symbols" section in "Script-to-Viz" tab on right panel
â‘¡ Select desired symbol
â‘¢ Hold left mouse button and drag symbol
â‘£ Drag to target frame
â‘¤ Release mouse to place

Available Symbols:

Basic Camera Movements:

1. â† Pan Left
   Purpose: Camera moves horizontally left
   Effect: Shows left side of scene
   Use cases: Follow character left, sweep left environment
   
2. â†’ Pan Right
   Purpose: Camera moves horizontally right
   Effect: Shows right side of scene
   Use cases: Follow character right, sweep right environment
   
3. â†‘ Tilt Up
   Purpose: Camera moves vertically up
   Effect: Sweeps from bottom to top
   Use cases: Show high objects, low-angle shot, establish space
   
4. â†“ Tilt Down
   Purpose: Camera moves vertically down
   Effect: Sweeps from top to bottom
   Use cases: High-angle shot, discover ground objects, establish space

Depth Movements:

5. âŠ• Zoom In
   Purpose: Camera moves forward or magnifies
   Effect: Emphasize subject, create tension
   Use cases: Close-up, highlight details, build drama
   
6. âŠ– Zoom Out
   Purpose: Camera moves backward or reduces
   Effect: Show full scene, establish space
   Use cases: Establish location, show overview, create distance

Advanced Techniques:

7. ğŸŒ€ Dolly Zoom
   Purpose: Simultaneous push and zoom for unsettling effect
   Effect: Background distortion, psychological pressure
   Use cases: Horror, suspense, thriller moments, psychological shifts
   Tip: Usually used alone, not combined with other movements
   
8. ğŸ‘ï¸ POV Shot
   Purpose: Shoot from character's perspective
   Effect: Audience sees through character's eyes
   Use cases: First-person view, character's subjective experience, discovery
   Tip: Often combined with other movements

Symbol Effects:
â€¢ Symbols display on frame
â€¢ Included in export information
â€¢ Referenced during batch redraw
â€¢ Multiple symbols can be placed on same frame

Usage Tips:
â€¢ Multiple symbols per frame show execution order
â€¢ Dolly Zoom usually used alone
â€¢ POV Shot often combined with other movements
â€¢ Basic movements (Pan, Tilt) for scene sweeps
â€¢ Depth movements (Zoom) for emphasis and space
â€¢ Advanced techniques for special emotional expression

sections.title: 9. Prompt Preview & Edit
sections.content:
Use when: Need to view or modify export prompts

Steps:
â‘  Select frames to export
â‘¡ Click "Preview Prompts" button on right panel
â‘¢ Preview window opens
â‘£ Click "ä¸­æ–‡" or "English" to switch language
â‘¤ Edit prompts in text box if needed
â‘¥ Click "Copy" to copy current version to clipboard
â‘¦ Click "Download" to save as text file

Features:
â€¢ Language toggle: Preview Chinese or English version
â€¢ Copy function: One-click copy to clipboard
â€¢ Download function: Save prompts as .txt file
â€¢ Edit function: Modify prompts directly in preview

Prompt Contents:
â€¢ Global instructions: Style, aspect ratio, restrictions
â€¢ Scene numbers: SC-01, SC-02, etc.
â€¢ Scene descriptions: Detailed description for each scene
â€¢ Actions & Motion: Camera movements from symbol library

sections.title: 9.1 Single Frame Redraw
sections.content:
Use when: Need to modify and regenerate single frame

Steps:
â‘  Right-click frame to redraw
â‘¡ Select "Redraw (View Script)"
â‘¢ Edit window opens
â‘£ Modify prompt content
â‘¤ Click "Redraw" button
â‘¥ Wait for new image generation

Use Cases:
â€¢ Adjust details of single frame
â€¢ Modify camera angle or movement
â€¢ Change scene elements
â€¢ Optimize composition

âš ï¸ Note:
â€¢ Only affects that frame
â€¢ Other frames unchanged
â€¢ New image replaces original

sections.title: 9.2 Batch Redraw
sections.content:
Use when: Need to modify multiple frames at once

Steps:
â‘  Multi-select frames to redraw (Shift + Click or box select)
â‘¡ Right-click any selected frame
â‘¢ Select "Batch Redraw"
â‘£ Batch redraw dialog opens
â‘¤ Enter improvement instructions for each frame
   â€¢ Use SC-01, SC-02 buttons to switch frames
   â€¢ Enter instructions in text box
â‘¥ Click "Batch Redraw" button
â‘¦ System generates new images sequentially

Use Cases:
â€¢ Unify style across multiple frames
â€¢ Add same elements to multiple frames
â€¢ Batch improve image quality
â€¢ Quick iteration of multiple versions

Effects:
â€¢ Each frame generated independently
â€¢ Original symbol marks preserved
â€¢ Success/failure statistics shown after completion

sections.title: 9.3 Clone Frame
sections.content:
Use when: Need to duplicate a frame to new location

Steps:
â‘  Right-click frame to clone
â‘¡ Select "Clone"
â‘¢ New frame appears near original
â‘£ Drag new frame to desired location

Use Cases:
â€¢ Create similar scene variations
â€¢ Quickly duplicate reference subject
â€¢ Build foundation for frame sequence
â€¢ Save reusable frame templates

Effects:
â€¢ Completely duplicates all frame attributes
â€¢ Includes prompt, symbols, aspect ratio, etc.
â€¢ New frame gets new ID
â€¢ Can be edited independently

sections.title: 9.4 Download Single Frame
sections.content:
Use when: Need to download individual frame

Steps:
â‘  Right-click frame to download
â‘¡ Select "Download Image"
â‘¢ Image auto-downloads to local device

Download Details:
â€¢ Format: PNG format
â€¢ Naming: Auto-generated timestamp name
â€¢ Location: Browser default download folder

Use Cases:
â€¢ Save individual frame separately
â€¢ Use in other projects or presentations
â€¢ Backup important frames
â€¢ Share with team members

sections.title: 9.5 Color Mode Toggle
sections.content:
Use when: Need to switch between color and B&W sketch

Steps:
â‘  Click ğŸŒ¸ (Color) or âš« (B&W) button in left toolbar
â‘¡ Button highlights to show current mode
â‘¢ New generated images use that mode

Mode Explanation:
â€¢ ğŸŒ¸ Color mode: Generate color frames
â€¢ âš« B&W mode: Generate black & white sketch style

âš ï¸ Important:
â€¢ Mode switch only affects newly generated images
â€¢ Already generated images unchanged
â€¢ To convert existing images, regenerate them
â€¢ B&W mode good for concept stage and quick iteration

Use Cases:
â€¢ Use B&W sketch for concept validation
â€¢ Use color for final presentation
â€¢ Mix both modes for comparison

sections.title: 10. FAQ
sections.content:
Q1: How to maintain character consistency?

A: Upload reference subject. System maintains 100% character appearance consistency.


Q2: Export order is wrong?

A: Box-select frames in desired order. System numbers by selection order.


Q3: B&W mode still generates color?

A: New images generated after mode switch apply the new mode.


Q4: How to clear chat history?

A: Click ğŸ§¹ Clear button next to input.


Q5: Difference between Script-to-Viz and Creative Chat?

A:
Script-to-Viz: For complete scripts, one-time generation
Creative Chat: For brainstorming, multi-turn conversation


Q6: Why "frames must be same ratio" error?

A: System requires all exported frames use same ratio.


Q7: How to generate different ratios?

A: Select ratio before generating. Generate multiple times for different ratios.


Q8: Can canvas mix different ratios?

A: Yes, but export requires same ratio for all selected frames.


Q9: How to resize frames?

A: Drag bottom-right corner triangle. Aspect ratio maintained.


Q10: Single vs multiple select?

A:
Single: Select one frame for individual operations
Multiple: Select multiple frames for batch operations


Q11: How to use batch redraw?

A:
â‘  Multi-select frames (Shift + Click)
â‘¡ Right-click â†’ Batch redraw
â‘¢ Enter instructions for each frame
â‘£ Click Submit


Q12: What is reference subject?

A: Maintains character consistency across all generated frames.


Q13: How to edit single frame prompt?

A: Right-click frame, select "Redraw (View Script)", edit prompt in window, click "Redraw".


Q14: What is prompt preview for?

A: View complete export prompts, toggle Chinese/English, copy or download for other tools.


Q15: How to quickly duplicate a frame?

A: Right-click frame, select "Clone", new frame appears nearby, drag to desired location.


Q16: What symbols are available in symbol library?

A:
Basic movements: â† Pan Left, â†’ Pan Right, â†‘ Tilt Up, â†“ Tilt Down
Depth movements: âŠ• Zoom In, âŠ– Zoom Out
Advanced techniques: ğŸŒ€ Dolly Zoom, ğŸ‘ï¸ POV Shot


Q17: Difference between Dolly Zoom and regular zoom?

A:
Regular zoom (âŠ•âŠ–): Changes focal length only
Dolly Zoom (ğŸŒ€): Simultaneous push and zoom, creates unsettling distortion effect, for horror/suspense scenes


Q18: How to use POV Shot?

A: Used for shots from character's perspective. Lets audience see what character sees, increases immersion. Often combined with other movements.


Q19: Can I place multiple symbols on one frame?

A: Yes. Multiple symbols on one frame show execution order of multiple camera movements.


Q20: Do symbols affect final video generation?

A: Symbol information is included in prompts to guide AI for corresponding camera movements. Also referenced during batch redraw.
